title: Shipping fees spiked with no warning beforehand
text:
The only advantage that Vinted had over its competitors is that it would let sellers see how much they‚Äôd be paying for an item with the buying fee (whatever you‚Äôd like to call it) included. They didn‚Äôt just spring it at you during the final steps at checkout. Unlike Etsy, Mercari, and eBay, sellers didn‚Äôt have to worry about Vinted taking a huge bite out of their profits after selling an item either. 

Unfortunately that‚Äôs about all the good things I can say about Vinted. Unlike their competitors eBay and Mercari, who encourage users to list as many items as possible, Vinted actively DISCOURAGES this. They‚Äôll arbitrarily claim you‚Äôre selling for profit (duh?) and threaten to suspend your account. 

Then to make things infinitely worse, they suddenly raised the shipping fees with little to no warning beforehand. Small parcels used to be $0.99; now it‚Äôs $6.92. Larger parcels faired worse with medium parcels being about $13 and large parcels being about $24 to send now. Simply absurd.

title: I do NOT recommend Vinted - they‚Äôll delete all ur listings!
text: I‚Äôve just had ALL my listings deleted without any warning or chance to change them! The message states that my listings don‚Äôt fall under their ‚ÄòCatalog rules‚Äô & that I used stock photos or photos from the internet that aren‚Äôt mine. Everything I had listed is mine! All the beauty products are brand new & factory sealed. Every photo I had in my listings are also MINE! They‚Äôre not stock photos or photos I stole from the internet. I take time on my listings & try to make them as nice & detailed as I can then without a warning Vinted carelessly deletes all of them without even messaging me & given me a chance to edit/change them! I‚Äôve gone through & checked everything in their ‚Äòcatalog rules‚Äô that may be a possibility of why my listings were deleted & not 1 of them applies to my items. I don‚Äôt work or advertise for anyone, I don‚Äôt have multiple or bulk amounts of anything either. My listings include items, such as things I got for my bday or as a gift, or that I‚Äôve had sitting around my house & I need to declutter before we move, etc. They‚Äôre not illegal, offensive, stolen, counterfeit. They‚Äôve accused me of either using stock photos, photos from the internet, selling fake or illegal items, selling something that doesn‚Äôt belong to me, selling beauty items that aren‚Äôt brand new, using a shared family account, selling items in bulk, working for or promoting a business, etc. U literally can‚Äôt sell anything!! For whatever reason they were deleted I can almost guarantee it didn‚Äôt apply to all of them! If you‚Äôve read this far: I DO NOT RECOMMEND VINTED TO ANYONE!

title: Vinted Rep TRIED to SCAM me for my FULL card details!!
text:
I wish this let me update a photo!!
Vinted Support trying to scam users for their card details!!! SCAM ALERT!!!

In order to change my phone number since their site doesn‚Äôt work and gives an error message when doing so, apparently Vinted needs your full card details INCLUDING the CVV code to ‚Äúverify‚Äù it‚Äôs you.

First, they asked me for a screenshot of a purchase I‚Äôve made from Vinted on my bank statement, I gave it blurring everything else out.

Apparently, that wasn‚Äôt enough, so they then needed more verification.

They then proceeded to ask for a photo of my card. I sent a screenshot of my card on my account (only showed last 4 digits and my Full Name registered on Vinted) thinking that would be enough. It wasn‚Äôt.

I was then asked for a photo of my card. 

By this point I‚Äôm getting severely creeped out as I already done 2 verification processes to obviously verify it was me just as they stated.

I took a piece of paper to cover the sensitive information, leaving my name, last 4 digits and expiration date visible. Thinking that should do the trick, I was SHOCKED when I was then asked for my FULL CARD DETAILS by a rep from Vinted support!!!!

So in order to change your phone number on Vinted (keep in mind, I have access to my number on file, just wanted to change it to another one but their site is glitched if you read reviews on changing phone numbers) you have to go through 3 verification processes they do not tell you about making you think it‚Äôs only ONE (they make you think it‚Äôs 1 at first, then ask for 2, then 3!!)

I truly don‚Äôt understand why they expect anyone to be that stupid, to give their full card details in order to verify a person, on the account that is messaging them from their account, that still has access to their original number, who already supplied their previous verification methods)

I 100% know this was a scam by their reps and my card would‚Äôve started getting unauthorized charges immediately if I had done so. Their site needs to be shut down! I immediately removed my card from their site, requested a new card to be safe right after, and am awaiting my orders to be completed before deleting the account. This was 100% a scam to steal my information! I reported the rep, and was gave a generic message back 10-15min later saying they took care of it.
